title: Hot property: homes by the water
text:
House, Deià, Mallorca, Spain, €11.9m

Where On the west coast of Mallorca near the popular village of Deià. Palma airport is about 36km away, or 40 minutes by car.

What A five-bedroom, five-bathroom country house with marble flooring and, for the cooler season, underfloor heating. A separate guest house has two bedrooms.

Why The property has sea and coastline views and an infinity pool.

Who Engel & Völkers

House, Benenden, Kent, UK, £3.75m

Where About one and a half miles from the village of Benenden in Kent. London is 60 miles or a little under two hours drive away.

What A nine-bedroom, four-bathroom Grade II property known as The Moat. The oldest part of the main building dates from the 15th century and retains original exposed ceiling and wall timbers.

Why The moat is a particular feature of the property, which sits on 22 acres and has its own lake.

Who Knight Frank

Apartment, Battersea, London, £3.45m

Where In south-west London on the banks of the Thames, close to Battersea Bridge and Battersea Park. It is near bars and restaurants on the south side and, to the north, the ever-fashionable Chelsea.

What A two-bedroom apartment with 24-hour security and concierge, plus a gym and tennis court for residents. It comes with two underground car park spaces.

Why The balcony overlooks the Thames with river views to the west.

Who Savills

Apartment, Amsterdam, Netherlands, €2.1m

Where In the redeveloped wharf area of Amsterdam-Noord by the Singel, one of the city's oldest canals. It has easy access to restaurants, art galleries and the central Dam Square.

What A four-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment with balcony and a small west-facing garden.

Why The elevated ground-floor living area faces the Singel.  

Who Knight Frank
